bibl.title: Establishing Roman Rule in Egypt: The Trilingual Stela of C. Cornelius Gallus from Philae.

series.title: Culture and History of the Ancient Near East.

bibl.title: Tradition and Transformation: Egypt under Roman Rule. Proceedings of the International Conference, Hildesheim, Roemer- and Pelizaeus-Museum, 3-6 July 2008
bibl.author: MINAS-NERPEL, Martina

bibl.note: Introduction. - 1. The identity of the horseman in the lunette. - 2. The iconographic analysis of the lunette. - 3. Gallus' self-portrayal according to his stela: Literary sources; - The Gallus stela; - Termination of the Egyptian revolts; - The reorganisation of the Triakontaschoinos; - The relationship with the Meroitic king; - The appointment of a tyrant in Lower Nubia; - The questions of authority; - Assessment of the classical inscriptions of the Gallus stela. - 4. Conclusion.
bibl.seg: MINAS-NERPEL Martina and Stefan PFEIFFER, Establishing Roman Rule in Egypt: The Trilingual Stela of C. Cornelius Gallus from Philae.

Katja LEMBKE, Martina MINAS-NERPEL and Stefan PFEIFFER (Edd.), Tradition and Transformation: Egypt under Roman Rule. Proceedings of the International Conference, Hildesheim, Roemer- and Pelizaeus-Museum, 3-6 July 2008 = Culture and History of the Ancient Near East. 41 (Leiden, 2010) pp. 265-298, 10 figg.
